summary: The document is a classified dispatch from 1968, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It details information obtained from the interrogation of Ricardo Ismael VALLECILLO Perez, a member of the Guatemalan FAR (Fuerzas Armadas Rebeldes), regarding the shipment of weapons and money from Cuba to Guatemala. The information includes the names of two officials from the Cuban Embassy in Mexico City allegedly involved in the arms trafficking. The document suggests passing this information to the Mexican Service if deemed valuable.
key_findings: Interrogation of a Guatemalan FAR member revealed plans to receive a new type of machine-pistol called the Red Star from Cuba.
Two officials from the Cuban Embassy in Mexico City, Alfredo MIRAMBAL Diaz and Raeto Ido CAYO, were named as involved in shipping weapons and money.
The information was considered for sharing with the Mexican Service to aid in intelligence efforts.
keywords: John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act
